attributes.action: advise North Cheshire Trusts on their anti - coagulant policy
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The benefits of leg exercises TED stockings, to reduce the risk of DVT post - surgery are long since recognised, especially for orthopaedic patients, but can the DoH please supervise more closely my local trust.
The health education leaflets despatched on discharge to exercise lower limbs includes advise to place a rolled up towel or cushion beneath the ankles and/or knees - a practice which has been discredited. Please encourage the Trust to add a codicil to their inaccurate teaching materials that elevation in this way is for the sole purpose of exercising and compression of the limb in anyway, for long periods and whilst static is dangerous. Please can the P.M. answer - where is the evidence that discharge on subcutaneous anti - coagulants is best practice ? As I understood it, clotting times need to be checked (especially if post - surgery the patient may be hypo - volaemic).
